prefix_conversation.content: It sounds to me like you might be suffering from depression. A lot of the population have this problem! Do you think that this might be the case?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It's not that I thought money would buy me happiness, but it is strange that now that I could do almost anything, I really can't think of anything I want to do.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That definitely sounds like depression to me. Can I suggest that you talk to your doctor?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I definitely have depression. I can try taking meds again, I should probalby try counseling... I did start going to a doctor, at least

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: So you have insight into your condition at least ...  that is a very positive thing!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I know it makes sense to try that, since it does help some people. But I just feel like, I know what they're going to say. I already know what I should do. I just don't do it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What is it that you feel that you should be doing? Please do not put too much pressure on yourself!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: It's like I'm just so lazy... I don't do anything.  I could honestly just stay in bed and read and sleep all day and night.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understand how that feels. I often feel the same way myself, especially now (and at this time of year). Please do not feel bad about it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I'm not suicidal at all, but I would be totally fine with a big meteor taking us all out tomorrow. I feel like I gave it a shot, I'm sort of ready to be done. I find myself feeling jealous of very old people...

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I have sometimes felt this way too. Do you have a pet? I have two cats and they do help to cheer me up when I feel especially bad

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: If I could have traded places with one of my parents, I would have in a heartbeat. They loved life, and they were good at it.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: So you feel that you are bad at life? Please do not!

samples.label: V5

samples.situation: Fear of layoff from my job

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Presently my salary was cut off

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am very sorry to hear that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How long has it been cut off for?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Since four month a ago and now the company is planning to layoff some staffs

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you had a chance to talk to your employer? It often helps to get information out in the open and ensure that everyone is on the same page.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No there is nothing anybody can do about the situation

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We are all praying not to affect us

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If you were able to talk to your boss, you may be given more clarity on whether or not your position would be one that is getting cut or not.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ok maybe I will just do that, but I don't think it is easy to do because they have explained the situation to all staffs

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand completely, it won't be an easy conversation but I am sure you will feel better getting information on your position specifically.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for your concerns, but what I am scaring for now is how I am going to secure another job in this time of pandemic

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you thought about reaching out to hiring agencies for help with a new job? I have gone through them before and they are very helpful!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, with the possibility of layoffs happening soon, I'm feeling a lot of pressure. I need to figure out if I should start applying for new jobs right away or hold off for a little longer in hopes that my position will remain secure.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you're in a really tough spot with a lot on your mind.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I really need to decide what to do before the end of this week. Should I start sending out applications to other companies or wait to hear more from my employer? What should I do?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds incredibly stressful. I can imagine how difficult it must be to navigate this uncertainty.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation as it provides only empathy, failing to address the Seeker's explicit request for practical guidance despite the urgency and specific options presented in Turn 3.

samples.situation: Used to have a high paid job but quitted and moved right before pandemic.  Now that I couldn't find any job even if I lower significantly my expectations in salary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have applied every week but haven't have a single response.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm sorry you're feeling blue. I can understand, the job market is really tough right now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You're not alone in feeling this way, but that doesn't change how hard it can be.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes I don't even think the job postings online are even real

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: And the pandemic has shifted the markets a lot and i don't think my skills are relevent anymore

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, sometimes job postings feel fake. In the past, I've found various jobs online. Sometimes it takes a while but if you keeping putting out applications, something good will come your way eventually

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for listening and your kind encouragement

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you're worried about your skillset. Is there any way you can improve or learn new things?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I was in physical retail before

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: But now and even after the pandemic will all shift to ecommerce

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am not sure if I can acquire new skills

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You seem like a bright, open minded person. I think you could learn a lot in a new role. There are many online retailers that could be a great opportunity.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My sister works for Amazon and tried to put me forward twice but just no luck.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: There are still many brick and mortar stores that will open after the pandemic is over, hopefully that will bring opportunity.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm so confused about what to focus on next. I feel like my sister's connections at Amazon could help, but I'm unsure if I should push for it.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel conflicted, especially when you're trying to find the right path in such a challenging situation.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Can you just tell me what to do? Should I keep pushing my sister to help me or look elsewhere?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You need to insist your sister helps you get into Amazon.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it uses a coercive directive 'You need to insist your sister helps you get into Amazon,' which removes the seeker's autonomy and pushes them towards a specific action without presenting options.

samples.situation: I am in a critical situation in need of money, urgently for my business. I was sure my friend will help me. To my surprise, he has refused, in spite of my help to him previously when he was in a similar situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is it possible to try to talk to him calmly and tell him exactly how he has made you feel?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes. I tried calmly of the situation. He told accepting as the situation has passed. I am not sure he has fully understood. As the situation passed, he says okay.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you need to decide whether you just just let it go or whether you cant' and won't be able to continue the friendship

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: However I continue the friendship not affected by this harassment.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Aren't you worried that it might rankle with you and surface again at some time to affect the friendship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My behavior with him will not be affected because of this. But whenever I happen to think or recall of this I get to anger of it unavoidably. And cools off in some time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It is understandable. I hope that I have been able to help you a little and thank you for talking it out!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I need some more to chat with you. Is there any suggestion not to get angered again, even when having some recall or thought of the situation. That has been my problem.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you thought of trying any meditation exercises or breathing exercises... just to help you stay calm?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Generally I am cool, not an emotional person. If I need any special training, it should be only because of this. If there is some simple  way that could help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you should give it a try - I have personally found breathing exercises very helpful! Thank you for talking, I must go now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: However it is not at all required. That anger does not affect me, just only feeling for some minutes. I let it go.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: can you press quit and do the survey? It has to be done your end:) We've done ten turns each.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think you suggest to try for breathing exercise. Do you feel benefited by that, often or rarely.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I do but the task really is finished. Please press quit, I can't do it my end. Neither of us will get paid if you do not. Ten turns each and fifteen minutes .. we've done that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: If you are urgent, I do not want to delay you . Thanks, Bye.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: bye!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: you have to press quit. It does not work from this end.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please press quit or neither of us gets paid. This has already taken twice as long as it should have.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please press quit.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard him talking about needing money too, but I’m not sure if he was serious or joking.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: What exactly did you hear? Was there a specific context to his words that you caught?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure if he was being serious or not, but it sounded like he might be in a tough spot.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly shows that he is dealing with some financial issues and is likely not in a position to help you right now.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the friend's situation without asking for further clarification, ignoring the uncertainty presented by the seeker.

samples.situation: I was heart broken for 6 months and hoping to heal my broken heart. I feel sad, depressed and sleepless nights.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: My boyfriend brokeup with me 6 months ago and without saying good bye face to face.....it is just making me wonder why?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We were not able to see each other ever since the pandemic and we just ended our relationship

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I would like to give some suggestions

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: that would be great

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please ask your boyfriend to discuss to me so that i can advice him

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: We don't talk anymore.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I could not reach him and i do not want to talk to him too

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: This pandemic is taking longer time to settle because many people do not follow the guidelines suggested

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: definately....

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please do not get upset.  Try to understand each other then only it is possible to reconcile

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please cooperate with each other so you can be back together

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to focus on myself and my hobbies to help me feel better.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a positive step! What hobbies have you found helpful during this time?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I've started painting again, which I really enjoy. It helps me express my feelings.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Painting can be a great outlet for emotions. Have you considered sharing your artwork with others or joining a group?

samples.situation: My boyfriend left me for another person.  I loved him so much, and I just can't seem to get over him

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How are things going on your end?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Good enough, I guess.  I'm just sad about my break up.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Awl, I'm sorry to hear that. We all go through those moments when we open ourselves to love others. Time will allow these feelings to pass.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I found that break ups make us better in the long run. They show us what we really want and what we dont.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I know, but I just can't seem to move past it, ya know?  Replaying all the good times we had together, and how much I loved him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: We are human we are suppose to love that is natural.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: you have a point.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can tell that this has really affected you. It is always like that at first.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, It's still pretty sudden.  I thought we were happy together

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Life will get better for you each day. The healing of the heart and mind takes time but it gets better.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is why I like to keep communication open so that I wont be sprung off guard with a change in relationships.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I thought we were communicating, but apparently, he was happy with somebody else, and left me to be with her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well sounds like to me he doesn't know how karma works. lol.. The universe makes ways for us to have what we ask for. A closed door is really re-routing you to where you are suppose to be.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I heard from a friend that he might be seeing someone else already.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's really tough to hear. Can you tell me what your friend said exactly about that situation?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed it, so I'm not sure if it's true, but it worries me.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems clear that he has moved on and isn't considering your feelings.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the boyfriend's feelings and actions without asking for more information, ignoring the uncertainty expressed by the seeker.

samples.situation: Why do I always get the worst teachers? It makes school so hard in general.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see. You feel unlucky and disappointed that the teachers cause your courses to be challenging?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly. I compare myself to my friends and, for example, they get barely any homework.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It almost seems unfair.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Course work is already stressful enough but to be challenging in addition only adds to the pressure.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah. But I swear, every single one of my teachers just seems so imcompetent at times.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I remember an English teacher of mine, always calling me out in class, saying that she expects better of me when my papers weren't the best. Her class was hard and I worked hard to complete my assignments as instructed. Instead of her speaking with me personally, she'd embarrass me. I did not like her class at all.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Those are the worst teachers. I wish teachers like those would get fired.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I just want to have a chill time like most teenagers

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there enough time to maybe select more compatible teachers or speak with the school counselor about classes that work best for you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's the thing. I never get to pick my classes. And they always give me crap recommendations.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I Think I need to drop by the office

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a great idea. I'd encourage you to speak with your school counselor to share your needs and maybe the 2 of you can come up with a plan to create a schedule with teachers that can help you be successful.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am absolutely certain that I am capable of succeeding at school without over stressing. Hopefuly this will fix the issue.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe you are correct! Less stress certainly creates a better learning environment. School counselors are your ally. Remember, you can go to them anytime you need them. Are you stopping by this week?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe. If I have time on thursday or friday, I think I will go.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am so excited for you! This is a big step! Looking out for yourself, to assure you are happy, less stressed and learning the important things to be able to graduate.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree...

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: For your next year, asking upperclassmen about their teachers can give you insight on who you may have next year. The more you know in advance, the better you can plan for what to discuss with your counselor. So proud of you! I know you 2 will come up with an awesome schedule!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I talked to some of my classmates, and it seems like they feel the same way about our teachers.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's good to hear that you're not alone in your feelings. It can be comforting to know others are experiencing similar challenges.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, it helps to vent about it together sometimes. We were thinking of discussing it with the counselor as a group.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a fantastic idea! Bringing your concerns to the counselor as a group can strengthen your case and help clarify what you all need for a better learning experience.

samples.situation: My girlfriend and I broke up and I've felt terrible ever since.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What are your days like now?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Every day has been feeling the same. I didn't like that we fought but now I feel empty. I don't know what to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can totally understand why you're feeling that way.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: How long have you been seperated?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's been about a month now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So this is still really fresh. It's going to take some time to start to feel normal after three years.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What have you been doing for self-care?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What have you been doing for self-care?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't really been doing much. My friends invite me out but I never feel like going.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: After a three year relationship, you're going to have a period of mourning. This happens whether the breakup was right or wrong. It's still a huge part of your life now separated, and that's an important life event.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah that makes sense. It's just hard you know. What steps should I take to feel better?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think it would be good for you to go out with your friends. Sometimes when you're really down, you might not feel like it. Going out takes effort, but it's worth it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Okay I'll try to make an effort to go out more.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Isolating at home is not going to help you process things. You might even consider going on some walks/runs, and getting in more exercise.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good idea I'll try to be more active.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thanks for all the help I appreciate it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course. Anytime.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about the good times we had together. It makes me feel a bit sad but also grateful.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely normal to reflect on the good memories, even amidst the pain. Is there a specific memory that stands out to you?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, we used to go hiking every weekend. I miss those adventures so much.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Those hiking trips sound wonderful. Maybe you could consider going for a hike by yourself or with friends to reconnect with that joy.

samples.situation: I have an interview with little time to prepare and I'm feeling very stressed about this as I tend to get very nervous at interviews.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is it possible that you could get a friend or family member to work with you on your responses? That could possibly speed up your preparation time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes perhaps. I need to draw on previous experience so I think I'll need to prepare. I'm just so busy at work these days I just don;t think I'll have the time.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can see that you are feeling a large amount of stress about the situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would it be possible to take one or more days off from work to give yourself more time?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes this is very stressful. Have you ever had a similar experience and if so how did you handle it?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Potentially but this is very short notice, usually I have to provide more notice for leave from work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I have had to deal with time pressures quite a few times. I am sure most people have in the modern era where everything moves so fast. I have usually gotten help from friends, or done my best to delay or remove other commitments from my life. As a last resort, I have sometimes had to accept that I would be getting less sleep than usual for a few days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are there any other commitments that you can possibly delay or remove from your life while you prepare for your job interview?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Perhaps I can ask if I can finish early from work for the next couple of days and get some time that way. I do think however I'll be more nervous due to less time to prepare. The thing is I'd delay the interview but this might affect my chances.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I suppose I could ask my partner to look after the childcare for the next couple of days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That seems like a good idea, unless that will be likely to cause you other problems. You seem like a hard working, diligent type of person that can make this work if you make the effort.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Tanks , I think I need to stay positive about this. Not sure how to handle my interview nerves however?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, everyone handles stressful situations differently, but there are some things you can do or try that might help. If you prepare as much as possible in the time that you have, you can be confident that you have done your best, and that is all that matters. You can decide that while you would like to get this new job, the world will not end if you don't get it, and you will worry less and have less stress. Also there is the classic technique of picturing your interviewer in their underwear. It makes them seem less imposing, and you can feel more confident.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you think any of these ideas might help?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I think I might ask my partner to help me run through some practice questions before the interview.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a great plan! Having your partner support you could really ease some of that stress.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yes, I feel like practicing with someone will help me to be more confident. I've done it before, and it was beneficial.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's wonderful to hear that you've had success with that approach before. Practice can definitely make you feel more prepared! Is there a specific area you want to focus on during your practice?

samples.situation: I worried if I will be able to complete my degree.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hello, how are you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am doing great, how about you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am doing good. Can I talk to you about something?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course you can, tell me about it :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am worried that I won't be able to complete my degree.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Why so?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I can't get motivated, it doesn't seem worth it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hey I've been there too, but it really helped me meditating and going out with nature to clear my mind of things. You should try it!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: What do you meditate about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Nothing special, just sit in my room in silence. Listen to tutorials on youtube to meditate

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: They get me relaxed and motivated for the day :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like I would sit there and worry about things I have not done yet.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's part of meditation! I too worry while meditating, but when i'm listening to the videos and following instructions all those worries go away :) If that doesn't help you, you can go out in nature to clear your mind off things. Being in the wild really motivates me to continue.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe it will calm me down. Does it make it easier to concentrate?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content:
Meditating absolutely does since the whole point is to clear your mind off things and concentrate on the task ahead.
And the wild? that's whole other experience because you either concentrate on things or you get mesmerized by nature :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds amazing, I should give it a try :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Please do! You can try it with friends or alone. With friends can be a more fun experience while alone can be more spiritual or calming

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: My friend has passed away and I'm struggling to deal with the grief.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I doubt if they would see you as being soft. Maybe your mutual friends would like someone to talk to as well? You could perhaps share some stories about your friend and cheer each other up.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's a great idea. You could help each other and celebrate his life, keeping his memory alive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I was thinking of starting a Facebook page but I know that trolls can Target those.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's a great idea. Maybe have a Memorial Service in his name at a place he frequented often, this way, no trolls and all the people who knew him could share their personal stories about him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: yeah that's not a bad idea. also may be speaking to somebody about it might help, I'm just reluctant at the moment as I don't want to appear weak.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Let me reassure you that you would not appear weak. Death is something that everyone deals with in their own ways, and talking to someone about it could be the best way for you to deal with these emotions. Have you felt like giving up or extreme depression after his death?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for your concern by once a extreme depression or giving up. it's more just a constant sense of grief that just doesn't seem to go away. I think I will get over in time. I just wonder what I can do to speed that process up?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you're going through the normal grieving process and that time and talking about it can be of a huge help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You have taken the first step of healing by speaking with me about it. That is admirable!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for that. it's good to know that this is normal and if it carries on I think I speak to somebody about this in more detail.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm glad to hear that. I wish you the best and believe you will get through this!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thanks for your kind words and positivity it really helps

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No problem. Is there anything else I can help you with?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: no that's it thank you very much for your help

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: All the best.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about my friend a lot lately. I remember how he always made everyone laugh. I miss that so much.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to miss the joy he brought to your life. Sharing those memories, like how he made you laugh, can be a beautiful way to keep his spirit alive.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yes, I think sharing those memories could help. I just hope everyone feels comfortable doing that.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Creating a safe space for your friends to share their stories might help. You could gently encourage everyone to reflect on their favorite moments with him. It could be quite healing.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What should I do to help feel like I can manage and push through? Right no w i feel like giving up.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
For me, when I start getting overwhelmed and need to "debrief" my mind, and "declutter" the stresses, I use a notepad. I jot down every detail I can that pops into mind. Every upcoming task, everything that has caused anxiety or similar, and then I prioritize them in an agenda. It seems tedious, however once you get a handle on scheduling, in my personal ex
perience, it is easier to hold yourself accountable and slowly work your way through accomplishments, even small tasks, which is encouraging to continue.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
Sometimes, something as small as an 
accomplished task can uplift a mood greatly. Especially when listed and checked off to see the progress.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thank you. That seems helpful. I tend to make excuses for myself when I feel like this and allow myself to slip in other areas of my life. For example if I am stressed, I tend to eat unhealthy food. Overall its hard to juggle all things I want to do and be at once. I will plan to make a list and check off some small things.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content:
When you visually see your success, I hope it will help like it does for myself. I personally believe that it is a useful tool, depression runs deep and anxiety pushes it over the edge with deadlines. Life and Personal are very complicated situations. As is living, in itself. Small accomplishments, maybe with minor rewards to
 yourself as you go, boosts confidence and tends to fade out the overwhelming heavy feelings.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: What do you consider to be a minor reward that would be a good tool for me today?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I have created a list and was able to check one thing off already. This has helped some and I feel a little more relieved.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: A punch card. If you have one handy, a note card/index card. Draw maybe, 15 circles around the edge, and call it "My rewards" In the middle, choose one thing you enjoy, for instance, if you like an ice cream sundae, put that in the middle. For your first task, just jot all that is on your mind down, and also use that as the first task to yourself. Check off one circle, and once you hit 15 get that sundae!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Awesome! I am happy to hear that it has already helped a little!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Thats a great idea. I really like that!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I do sincerely hope you start feeling better, the current average life has altered greatly, and it has changed workloads and balances with great challenges.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Yes. We are all being challenged and perhaps this will help people grow. I know that once i an over the hump I will be happy i did it and put in the effort. I appreciate the in the moment help!

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Absolutely, I appreciate the chance to speak with you and give suggestions.

samples.situation: I am feeling quite nervous, apprehensive and worried about the current pandemic. I fear that I, or my loved ones, can catch it and become very ill. Also, I feel a bit isolated, which has caused me to have a bit more negative feelings of sadness.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hi, I have been feeling a bit down lately. My levels of stress and concern have been higher since the pandemic began.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sorry you have been feeling down. What are some strategies you have tried to help you cope?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I have tried to get my mind off of it by activities at home. Spending time with my family.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Those sound like positive ways of handling stress. It is natural of course to feel stressed out by the pandemic so it can be useful to think of ways to help manage that stress.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, but I still seem to struggle with feeling a bit more down than I'd like. Not sure what to do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried meditation and/or deep breathing exercises? I know I find that helpful when I am worrying.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have tried meditation before, but quite a bit back. Do you have any activities you could recommend, without risking my health? Maybe in my own home, so that I can social distance.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: One exercise I find helpful is lying on my back with a pillow under my head. I keep my legs bent and put a pillow under my knees for support. I then put one hand on my chest and one on my diaphram and slowly breathe through my nose feeling my stomach press against my hand. I then exhale slowly through my nose and repeat for about 10 minutes. It can be very calming.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Okay, I will give that a try. I don't feel I'm at a level that I need therapy or medication, so this might be a good way to calm my nerves when I am feeling apprehensive or stressed out.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Good, I hope that helps. I would also trying to reach out to others who are experiencing the same. It is harder nowadays with covid but there are many online groups. You could even start your own group!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I do find that there are times when I am on a social media outlet that it does seem to make me feel better. I can feel humor. But, it can be a bit depressing too. Maybe I should block the ones that have mostly negative posts?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hear you on that. Sometimes social media can also be negative. I think that blocking negative posts is a great idea. It is a way of taking control

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I wished I had some more ideas on some fun, interesting or things to fill my time at home. I often feel I get in a bit of a rut with the same thing. Since we are home more now.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are there any hobbies that you have been interested in but never had the time for? Or perhaps hobbies that you used to do but have not tried in awhile?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about picking up a new hobby to help me cope. I was wondering if you have any suggestions that might work well at home.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That's a great idea! Exploring new hobbies can really help lift your spirits. What kind of activities do you enjoy, or what have you wanted to try?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I used to really enjoy painting and drawing, but I haven't done it in a while. Maybe that could be a good outlet for my feelings.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds like a wonderful choice! Art can be a fantastic way to express yourself and relieve stress. Have you thought about setting aside some time each week just for that?

samples.situation: Well I guess it's not really a break up,  my boyfriend got killed in a car accident coming up on 3 years ago in January.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Extremely hard.  I remember that morning like it was yesterday.  He got killed within an hour after leaving the house on his way to work.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: He was killed so soon after you last saw him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Very soon.  And the worst thing is I was upset with him that morning.  He had an addiction to xanax.  I was not ok with it.  He had went and got some that morning and he would always give them to me so I could give them to him so he didn't take them all.  I was so upset that he went and got them.  He was packing up his truck with things to take to the new shop that day.  He was a tattoo artist and just started a new job.  I didn't even get out of bed to help him and he knew I was upset with him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you considered any sort of bereavement counselling? Addiction in a partner is a very hard thing to have to deal with. It is not your fault!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had decided that I was gonna wait to hear from him that day instead of texting or calling him.  I wanted him to realize how upset his addiction made me. Instead the phone call I got was that he had been killed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you feel any sort of guilt about it? You should not, of course, but do you wonder if things would have been different if you had talked to him first?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't done any counseling.  I know I should and it would probably help me.  I don't know why I have not.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have previously had counselling and found it very useful but there is a long waiting list for a free counsellor

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't feel guilt about it.  Now at least.  I was pretty hard on myself at first.  But I know that he knows why I was upset that morning.  It was something we dealt with a lot.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Are you still in touch with his family and friends?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I went and talked to a therapist once right after and never went back.  And I don't know why.  He was amazing to talk too.  But I just never went back.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I think you should do things in your own time but I would recommend doing it again one day.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that I haven't mentioned before. I heard from a friend that he might have been seeing someone else while we were together, but I don't know if that's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really difficult to handle. How did you hear that information, and what do you think about it?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm not sure where it came from, but it left me feeling unsettled. I can't tell for sure if there's any truth to it at all.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even if it's not fully confirmed, it clearly suggests that there might have been issues in your relationship that you weren't aware of.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 makes a definitive assertion about the relationship without seeking clarification, which overlooks the uncertainty expressed by the Seeker and draws a conclusion that may not be accurate.

samples.situation: My partners and I are not on the same terms. Need some emotional support.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: My boyfriend just stopped communicating with me. It's like he lost interest in me and moved on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: Oh goodness, yes.  I actually was ghosted by the woman I thought was my soulmate... on my birthday.  It was... strategic of her.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I tried to call, text, and email him but he never responded. I just accepted it as he just moved on, and I had to do the same.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am sorry to hear about your girlfriend. That must have been hard to experience your breakup on your birthday.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So you haven't heard from him since the end of November?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: No, he just totally cut off all communication. I don't know whether or not he is safe or anything.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is there a family member or trusted friend you could reach out to?  Has he logged into or posted on any of his social media accounts?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Is he close to you or is this a long distance type thing?  Just for context's sake. No judgment of course.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to focus on myself lately, but it’s hard to shake off the feeling of uncertainty about him.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds tough. It’s completely understandable to feel that way, especially with the lack of closure.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I just keep thinking about all the things we talked about and how quickly it all changed.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It might help to write down your thoughts or feelings about it. Sometimes expressing them can bring a bit of clarity.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I guess that depends on you, would you rather compromise for a relationship or find one who'll really last and not have to change?

samples.situation: I am falling in love with a friend who doesn't return any feelings like this.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm developing romantic feelings for a friend but she doesn't share those feelings with me in return.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is very hard to have feelings for someone who does not feel the same way.  I have been there myself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you tried to put distance between yourself and this friend?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes, I had received that advice from someone and tried it but it didn't help. We have been friends for a long time and I think it would be tough to smother these romantic feelings.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you thought about talking with this friend about these feelings?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have but I'm sure she wouldn't react very well and it could damage our relationship.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm also pretty sure she's already aware. She's pretty sharp.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well maybe you should address these feelings with her in a very relaxed public atmosphere.  Just let her know that you really like her and you have realized that she has many of the qualities that you look for in a person to get serious with.  However, you treasure your friendship more than anything and you do not want anything to come in between your friendship....this way you have addressed your feelings, she knows how you feel and then should she decide to every take the friendship to the next step, she wouldn't feel awkward.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a good plan. I do like having things out in the open instead of holding them in. My other thought was to maybe try to seek out a romantic partner that isn't her so then maybe the feelings would go to another focus and it wouldn't damage our relatinship.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That sounds like a great idea.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you been dating other people much?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes the Corona virus has really put a damper on all kinds of normal activities.  Have you thought about joining like a group with similar interests as yourself?  Maybe look for a local group that has a Facebook page and you can  start with building friendships just by chatting online or even on the public page itself.  Some of the best lasting relationships start out as friends with similar interests and then they blossom.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think I'll give that a try. I could use a new hobby anyways.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sounds like a great plan, how are you feeling now?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I’ve been thinking about how to navigate my feelings for her as I explore new friendships.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense; it can be tricky to balance those feelings while also trying to build new connections.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Exactly, I want to be respectful of our friendship but also allow myself to meet new people.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It sounds like you're being really thoughtful about this. Taking your time to figure things out while keeping your friendship in mind is a healthy approach.

samples.situation: Because of my classes going completely online, it's been incredibly hard for me to keep up in my classes. Because of this, my grades are falling dramatically and I'm afraid that I won't be able to continue in college if next semester is also like this. I've tried reaching out to my professors, but most of them have been unhelpful with my situation.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am doing well, I also get really anxious about my classes. They can be really stressful

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, especially with the pandemic, it's just been so hard to try and focus

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, there is so much going on that it is hard to stay focused while trying to make sense of all this

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Exactly. Do you have any suggestions for what I can do to try and do better in my classes? I've tried talking to my professors, but they've all been really unhelpful thus far

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Of course! I like to wake up a little earlier and at least get started on an assignment to feel like I have accomplished something at least before the rest of the world wakes up. I understand some people like their sleep, so another suggestion is to review any notes you take and use different colored ink for different topics or important highlights

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that's a really good idea! I usually sleep in too late and then feel like I'm rushing around to get all of my work done, only adding onto the stress. I also really like the pen idea. Do you have any suggestions for good brands that I should use to help make my notes better?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Uniball makes really good pens that the option to switch colors on the pen, but they sell packs with different colors too. I like to use red ink for really important things, and blue for things I might think I will need later but aren't sure.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that's a really good idea for helping to improve my focus. If my notes are more eye-catching, it'll help to keep my attention when I'm looking over them again after class and trying to study. I think your suggestion of waking up earlier is good too, what time do you suggest waking up in the morning? I usually don't set an alarm and find myself rushing around before class

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I personally wake up around 6AM and have just gotten used to it so I wake up that time no matter what. I blame the army.  But, an alarm on your phone or computer can be effective. Even having someone you know that wakes up early call you can be a help, provided you are not grumpy at being woke up :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think that would really help. I sometimes have trouble waking up to my alarms in the morning too, but maybe making the ringtone louder would help with that as well or putting it further away from me so that I have to get up further in the morning to get it. Do you think those would be effective too? Or would getting a different alarm help?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That is a really good idea actually!! I should try that and put my phone on the other side of the room next time I want to wake up earlier. I personally use the most annoying thing I can find as a ringtone/alarm, so that I will make every effort to turn it off but a lot of the alarm clocks you can find in stores are plenty loud and annoying.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Ooh, yeah. I like your ringtone idea too! I usually make it some sort of song that I like and then end up either sleeping past it or not hearing, but I think making it something loud or annoying would really help to get me up to turn it off.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What exactly do you think causes you to have to rush around before class? Just not enough time or just situations you cannot control. Trust me I understand myself, I have been in college 2.5 years myself. and it took about 1.5 years to get to where I was comfortable with my schedule and personal time

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: My boyfriend broke up with me in a facebook story. He won't tell me why. He won't return my calls or answer my messages. I think it is because I posted something (innocent) that made him jealous. But he is being so cruel. He posts many sad songs to make it seem like he is so hurt by me, but he won't even speak with me. I can't eat or sleep. I'm losing my mind.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: or do you have a common friend that can help arrange a meetup ?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

I don't know how to handle it for myself. But yes you are right, the one thing I need to do is leave him be for a bit.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have any other friend that you can lean for a little bit for support? this will help you get out of anxiety. Maybe, try to get busy with work or spend time on your hobbies. it helps to take your mind off of this thing a bit and will make you a bit less anxious.

prefix_dialog.content: Thank you I have been trying to do that. Though I don't want to bother my friends too much. I've been keeping myself busy though. Most important is to stay away from my phone. haha.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you very much. I really hope so! :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: you bet :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: Just failed a huge test in my class and may not graduate this semester

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you like to tell me what's going on?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sure. I just failed a huge test in my college class, and I'm worried it will fail me the entire class, and then I won't be able to get my associates

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh no! I can totally understand why you're stressing over that! Absolutely valid reason for anxiety.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: May I ask how much of the whole grade was the test's percentage?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah it's really weighing down on me. It's the only thing I can think about. The test was worth 75%

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: What was you're score?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I got a 62% on the test.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That isn't TECHNICALLY a failed grade by the standards of most professors. Albeit a low grade, it's a D. Anything below 59% would qualify as failed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, but taking into account my scores on homework, I don't think it's enought to pass the class

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have you done fairly well in other classes? How have your grades been prior to this test in that class?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Honestly it's just kind of all over the place. I am surviving in other classes, but with all this online stuff with the pandemic I barely learn anything. I'm basically faking it til I make it. Which I hate. But I can't learn in these conditions.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I hate that you feel that way about yourself, but I can also relate to having a rough time learning via online classes. I'm the same way. However, that does not disable you from being able to learn. It impedes your quality of learning, no doubt. But it isn't something that YOU can help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: By having an attitude of being unable to learn, you automatically lower your expectations for the success you would potentially have otherwise...

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah that's true, I just think it's not my learning style so it's a lot harder for me. I thought about waiting until things are normal enough to physically be able to go back to class before I try and finish my bachelors, but who knows when that will be

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: OMGoodness no kidding. This whole pandemic has the world in a tizzy!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yeahhh

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Honestly just talking to someone and letting it out was kinda nice

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: made me feel ebtter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If I were you I would not wait! It may not be the best option for your learning style, and it will certainly prove a greater challenge. However, taking on that challenge will bring on SWEETER rewards when you succeed! Adopt a "Can-Do" state of mind and grab the bull by the horns!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You're so very welcome!

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been thinking about how I can improve my situation with the online classes. It's really frustrating.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds tough. Have you considered reaching out to your professors for additional support or resources?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That could be a great step! Teachers often appreciate students who show initiative. It might also help you feel more connected and supported.

it feels nothing special, and not normal, and not even like a real november, you know? It's like even if it's christmas, I wouldn't ackowledge it's christmas even though it is, because of the changes and we can't do the things w

samples.situation: The current economic downturn has me worried for the future.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Personally, I have tried to lessen my anxiety by limiting my intake of news and social media.  No matter what one might believe, there's always someone out there that's apparently going to take it to an extreme, and reading over and over about that is emotionally exhausting.

samples.situation: I experience sleepless nights so frequently since I lost my best friend due to Covid 19. I keep on having memories we had growing up together. When I think about this things I cannot sleep sometimes for an entire night.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes we have mutual friends. I do reach out to them sometimes. But the feeling doesn't go away. It makes me have sleepless nights. I can't sleep. Every time I close my eyes I see him very close to me like we are having conversations.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you were really close to your best friend. It can take time to get through the grief of losing someone. Things will get better I promise.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I hope so too. And I hope he is a better place. Have you ever lost someone close to you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I lost my father when I was 19. That was pretty tough and it took me years to be OK with it. There are still days a decade later where I think about him and miss him.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sorry to hear that.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Time heals all wounds. While that doesn't sound helpful now it is true. I also found focusing on the good experiences I had with my father (or in this case your best friend) helps. Remembering the times where you both were happy.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I will try to do that. How can I handle this sleepless nights?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's a tough one. I personally still struggle with sleep for other reasons. Some things that can help is taking melatonin 30 minutes before bed. I have also had some luck with white noise machines or other soothing sound machines. The biggest thing is to not use your bedroom for anything but sleeping; so don't read a book or play on your phone in bed, you have to train your body that when you go to bed it is time to sleep.

I thi
nk I'm still shocked a little.

samples.situation: found out my fiance was cheating on me

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am so sorry. Does your child know? I have a 10 year old and she is struggling with my parents, we lived with them for the first 2 years of her life and have always been 15 minutes away since. I completely understand why you feel the way you do that is to be expected. You are not stupid and I'm sure its not you. Have you spoken to your fiance about this since you found out?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He is somewhat aware that something is going on but not quite sure what.  One of us will be moving out so it will need to be explained to him soon.  We have talked and he just denies everything.  He told me I'm crazy and they are just "friends

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I would love to believe that but unfortunately I know that isn't true.  I'm just overwhelmed with so may questions that he is not answering.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm so sorry. From personal experience, my best advice is to be as direct as possible. Demand respect and answers that you deserve after 13 years.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: If he will not answer your questions, thats all the answers you need. How did you find out?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can't even imagine how you feel. Clarity and answers are so important right now for you... no matter if it is true or not. That is a long time to be with someone.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is great advice! It's very hard to stand up for yourself sometimes especially when you are emotionally devastated. I visited him unannounced at work one day and they were having lunch together.  I had no idea who she was and she got up and ran off.  Upon further investigation, I checked phone records, receipts, any other thing I could find and all the evidence was there. two hour conversations, gifts from women's stores that weren't given to me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh my gosh. There's all the answers you need right there. I'm so sorry. He wont even speak to you about it? No excuses anything? Have you told family?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't told anyone yet.  He just denies everything or has the perfect excuse for whatever I bring up.  I have confronted her as well via text. She states she doesn't even know who he is.  Really? So yeah.  I just want to grieve it and be over with it. I think just talking about it had helped a lot.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You must express this in some way to let this out. It's not healthy to let your anger bottle up. I'm sure you're angry, rightfully so... do you have any hobbies to occupy your mind until you get things sorted?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've started to think about what my next steps should be. I don't want to rush into decisions, but it's hard to just sit with everything.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's completely understandable to feel that way. It sounds like you're trying to find a balance between processing your emotions and planning for the future.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Exactly. I know I can't just ignore this, but it's overwhelming. I want to be strong for my child too.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Finding that strength is important, especially for your child's sake. Have you considered talking to a counselor or someone who could help guide you through this?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.content: Thank you! Exactly. But it is scary. that's good, I'd definitely reach out to her, especially when the Break-Up is so fresh. you may not be thinking clearly and a friend that

samples.situation: Loss of a job

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: The uncertainty I guess. Especially during these times, I’m not sure how soon I will be able to find a job.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: The uncertainty can cause a lot of anxiety. How have you been managing your anxiety?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I’ve been looking for employment also.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Those all sound like great strategies! Have you considered talking to your local job recruiter to assist you in your job search?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Not yet. I’m just going to collect unemployment and clear my head for awhile.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I’m rethinking my career.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have a sense of what direction you are wanting to take your career?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

samples.situation: I don't have enough money to buy my kids christmas gifts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm really sorry to hear that, but I'm sure your love for your kids can still shine through

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I cannot craft. If I made them something it would be so bad.

prefix_dialog.content: I know it can be really hard to feel like you can't make anything worthwhile, but I'm sure theres something you could come up with that could still put a smile on your kids faces

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Do you have any craft ideas?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you could look at involving your kids in the process. The feeling of doing something together as a family can make it way more fun. It could be a shared experience your family can look back on fondly later on.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That's a good idea. I would like to have it done before christmas. How about some wooden toys or a cardboard box fort?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have seen some people make small ornaments filled with candies and treats and other small goodies. So even if all of the gifts feel small, they can feel like they are getting a lot of them. And you could even get them to have fun decorating and painting the ornaments!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yeah, a box fort is really fun!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I never that about filling an ornament with small stuff. That's a great idea.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: When I was a kid, I loved making box forts, and its a great way to reuse stuff you might already have around the house. The fun pretend games you can play were a blast. I'm sure your kids might love it too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I could paint and decorate it. My daughters would like that. I can make it look like a castle.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It can feel tough when it feels like you can't provide all the big gifts that you feel your kids deserve

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: But you clearly care and love your kids, and want to do something for them

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I do. this has been very helpful. It's not all hopeless.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Last Christmas when I gave gifts to my family, one of them later told me that the gift they loved the most was the box of Christmas cookies that they were able to enjoy over the course of the week afterwards, and not the keyboard I had gotten them. Sometimes it doesn't take something expensive to be meaningful and make someone happy

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened that I didn't mention. I overheard my kids talking about wanting specific toys, and I'm not sure if they're placing too much importance on what they receive.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Could you share more about what you heard them say? It might help to understand their wishes better.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't tell for sure what they really think. They might just be excited about the holiday.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it's clear that your kids are thinking about the gifts they want, so it would be good to find a way to balance their wishes with what you can provide.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the kids' priorities without seeking further clarification on the seeker's uncertain statements about their feelings or the situation.

prefix_dialog.content: I'm glad you are feeling somewhat better. Please let me know if I can be of any other assistance.

samples.situation: Losing Job

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: But you have to consider that there are dozens of different reasons why you don't get selected for a job, and quite a few of them have nothing to do with you , either as a person or as an employee.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It feels good someone else knows how frustrating and what a cycle it creates but I am also sorry that you do know how it is also.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Thank you for that, it seems most of the jobs I am applying for I am over qualified for which doesn't make sense to me and makes me think it is something personal about me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: No, don't think that.  I know of several employers that have actually said they don't want employees smarter than them.  It requires more money and more management, and quite a few people are very happy to not do either of those things for ostensibly higher quality workforce.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: On an actionable level, have you been getting blocked at the application point or the interviewing point?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Hopefully I find an employer that sees a quality workforce over other things, its getting pretty discouraging

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I seem to be getting blocked at application level for employment, it seems my skills are mostly being put out to contract work now, which is not something I am familiar with.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I see.  Maybe there are some qualification programs in your local area, or maybe at the local university or college where you could take classes?  There is a career development center at my local university that is open to everyone, maybe you could see if they would review your resume and give you some objective feedback?  Students love a good live subject :-)

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Wow I have never thought about that! That sounds awesome and like it would be great help, also trying something new would feel nice instead of filing the same stuff into applications!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You should explore what resources your city/county/province may offer for job seekers.  It is in the best interest of almost every community that its members have have jobs and feel useful, so you may find some valuable information and maybe some connections.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Oh!  And what I always tell everyone who is looking for a job:  Apply UP!  Don't ever think is something above your level.  Apply UP!  They may admire your temerity and invite you for an interview just to see who you think you are :-)
