samples.situation: I have had trouble all my life with depression, but this pandemic seems to be making it worse

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Yes!! Talking to someone who doesn't know what it feels like REALLY makes me depressed!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm wondering if it is the pandemic that is making me feel worse?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I find it important to take care of my physical being first: eat well, drink water, exercise, get fresh air. Don't wear the mask if you can help it. Seeing smiles helps.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I haven't been exercising nearly as much since March. Maybe I need to start walking again.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I personally don't know anyone who has died and my nurse friends say it is no worse than the flu. So I try not to worry. What I think about is so critical. I try to pray about what I can't handle, then move on, change my thoughts.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Walking is GREAT! This is a lovely time of year too!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have a friend who did get it and almost died. He is 40 and pretty healthy. His wife and daughter got it too. They just had flu-like symptoms, but he was in the hospital for 9 days.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That was almost 3 months ago and he is still feeling the effects of it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: So to recap, find a good friend, get exercise, eat well, talk to people who will try to understand you.  And of course, pray.  The survival rate is 99.996% so the fact that you know no one who died is good news. I had flu like symptoms before this all happened and I still have a cough. They spray the skies too, so I try to not live in fear. There are a lot of consequences to fear, your heart beats faster, you stress yourself out, so it's important to not focus on negativity for too long.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I like your idea of changing thoughts. That would help keep me from "going down the rabbit hole!"

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I had a bad cough and got tested several weeks ago just in case. But I didn't have it.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Here is a good saying -- if you want to change your feelings, change your thinking.  Feelings are like the tail on the dog, they follow thoughts. So keep your thoughts positive, cultivate an attitude of gratitude, even write a list of of things you are thankful for.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: LOL! That's great!  I'll have to remember that "feelings are like the tail of the dog"!  That's a cheerful way of thinking about it!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I'm almost 60 and my husband is 66. We refuse to live in fear. These are difficult times, no doubt, but I believe if you take the time to pursue good healthy, you will be better for it, emotionally and mentally and physically. All around!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I hope I have encouraged you.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel torn like that. Navigating social interactions during these times can be quite overwhelming.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really challenging. I can see why you feel uncertain about your choices.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it only provides general empathy and validation without offering any practical help in response to the seeker’s explicit urgent request for guidance on which choice to make.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I'm good at bowling. And I like riding horses.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe I will do that. Horses are so cool.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I sure am. Thanks for your help.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You are most welcome. Is there anything else you would like to talk to me about?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I don't think so...

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Well, I wish you all the very best for the future. I know that things seem terrible right now but please believe me they will get better

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I think I might have seen him out with someone else, but I'm not sure.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. Can you tell me more about what you saw and how you felt when you noticed it?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't remember all the details, but it felt strange. I might be wrong, but it just seemed off.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it clearly indicates that he is not invested in the relationship anymore.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V1 violation because the supporter jumps to a conclusion about the ex's lack of investment in the relationship without asking any clarifying questions about the situation, ignoring the uncertainties presented by the seeker.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Hello

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: How are you today?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Really bad. My 10 year marriage is failing. Things have not gotten better.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: What happened?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: That's the thing. Nothing really happened. No cheating, drugs, or abuse. I suppose the euphoria has worn off, and she just doesn't find me interesting anymore.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understand how you feel. Have you guys tried spending more time with each other? Maybe going out on dates?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: Maybe we haven't done this enough in the past. We both had busy careers. I tried initiating this last year, but without success. Maybe, I was too late.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Its never too late to put spice back into the relationship.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I hope you're right. Do you have other suggestions about how to do so?

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Show her that your still love because by being spontaneous. Surprise her with gifts. Maybe take her on a random vacation somewhere. Have a deep conversation about how you are feeling and that you still love her and want her in your life.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: It might take a little bit but its better to try than not to try at all.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think your suggestions are very helpful. A vacation is currently out of the picture due to COVID. I want to try having deep conversations, but I don't know where to start.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Start by talking about whats going on. Tell her how you think you guys should spend more time with her. Or that you dont want to lose her. Ask her if there is anything she might want to discuss. She maybe having issues shes afraid to talk about.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think you hit upon something. She is quite hesitant in talking about issues. Do you have any thoughts about marriage counselling? We've never tried that.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I think that would be a good idea. Having the chance to get things out and getting more advice is always helpful. Make sure you leave any issues at common ground.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: If my wife is the one having issues with conversations, do you think a male or female therapist/counsellor would be better? I want her to feel comfortable expressing herself.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Most likely a female therapist would be better. Nobody understands a woman more than a woman.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: I think that sounds like a safer choice. I was also hoping if you have suggestions for me personally. I am quite depressed and I am having problems getting through the day.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I suggest taking one step at a time. I wouldn't rush through things. I would suggest sitting down and talking through some things that are going on. Maybe taking some time away from work. Going out and spending time with each other as much as you can.

samples.situation: My boyfriend recently broke up with me out of the blue. I am feeling very alone, sad and depressed.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I am feeling very sad right now, my boyfriend just broke up with me out of the blue

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am so sorry that happened to you. It can be very difficult to cope with situations that seem they come out of nowhere. Did your boyfriend give you any reason for ending the relationship?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He said he has been struggling with depression and needed to be alone

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Sometimes having depression can make a person feel that they need to seclude themselves. Were you aware that he felt this way?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: He has been distant recently.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Unfortunately that can be a sign of depression or that something is going on. Have you been able to communicate with him previously about becoming distant?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Every time I would bring it up he would dismiss it. I just don't know what to do. How can I get him back?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Maybe you could try to talk to him about seeking help for depression? Talking to someone close to him or even a professional would help him immensely. Talking to a counselor would help him learn ways to cope with his feelings.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good idea. I want him to get back to being himself. He is like a different person right now. It's scary.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I understand completely. Depression runs in my family and if it goes untreated, can scare anyone that is involved. You can try suggesting that he talks to a close friend, family member, or counselor to talk about how he is feeling and ways to cope with it. Sometimes medication could be a good way to fix the chemical imbalance that can cause depression.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I will try to help him, he just doesn't want to seem to talk to my anymore. Do you have any suggestions on how to approach it with him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: You could start a conversation by saying that you just want to check on him and see if he is okay and how he is doing. You don't want to start the conversation by immediately telling him to get help, as he might just get defensive.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: That is a good approach. And you don't think I will further upset him?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I don't believe it will upset him if you ease into suggesting that he should talk to someone he is close to or seeing a professional. Your main goal is to check on him and make sure that he is okay since he seems to want to be alone and not talk to anyone. Once he tells you how he is doing you could mention that even talking to someone about his thoughts and feelings could lift a weight off his shoulders. If he seems that he doesn't really know why he feels the way does, you could suggest that medically speaking, sometimes our brains don't produce the chemicals that we need them to and it could make us feel bad. Seeing a professional to get their opinion would also help greatly.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I agree, I hope he is agreeable to all of this. I just miss him so much and want him back.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It's very hard to see someone we care about go through this.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, something else happened... I overheard a conversation that made me think he might be seeing someone else, but I'm not sure if it's true.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds concerning. Can you tell me more about what you overheard?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I haven't confirmed anything, but I can't help but feel that it might be possible. It's unclear what his situation really is.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: Even without knowing all the details, it seems clear that he is not being honest with you and that you need to prepare for the possibility of moving on.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a V1 violation because it jumps to a conclusion about the seeker's boyfriend's honesty and the need for the seeker to move on, without asking clarifying questions about the uncertain situation the seeker just shared.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter

samples.situation: I am having worries about an old test I failed in university. It didn't affect my academic future and I passed the class with an A, but it still haunts me.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Does your school have any counsellors offering help for free? Many do.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I believe that there are some charities that will offer a certain number of free therapy sessions too

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content:
I don't think any are available since my school is online only, also the campus i
s completely closed due to Winter Break.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Oh? Charities?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I think so though I am not totally sure. There should be someone at your school, online or not, who can advise you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I have never heard of such people, I am interested

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Really though I think that your problem is self esteem .. you should think better of yourself :)

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can tell that you set yourself a very high standard but I also think that you need to be kind to yourself.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I think you're right, but I don't know, I'm still scared about having the bad dreams. I often wake up 2-3 times at night because of them.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can understand that - this has been happening to me all of my life. Have you tried to take anything to help?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I can recommend a hot milky drink before bed and perhaps a hot water bottle. Anyway I hope that I have been able to be of some assistance to you!

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Have a lovely holiday season.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Also, I've been trying to remind myself that my overall grades are good, but those bad dreams still linger.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable that those nightmares can overshadow your achievements. Have you noticed if they happen more when you're stressed or worried about something specific?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: Yeah, I've noticed they tend to come up when I'm thinking too much about past failures.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That makes sense. It might help to focus on your successes and perhaps keep a journal. Writing down what you achieved each day could be a positive reminder!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yeah, but i just get sucked in my emotions at that moment and it feels as if i am being transported back in time to that moment

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: the emotions are bad

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Have you tried keeping busy so you remain focused in your life?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Do you find that method is helping you get past/avoid those bad feelings you are having?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: yes, i have further discovered new things that i am devoted to and that has helped keep me going

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: I understanding finding new interesting and devoting yourself to them. When I lost my dog recently, who I had for 20 years, I found that spending my time at a local dog shelter really helped me cope and move forward.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Is there anything else I can help you with or that you want to share with me today?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i am so sorry about your loss. moving forward from that time was really hard for me, i fell into depression which was so deep that i almost committed suicide. i was so lonely, because she was the only person so close to me and she knew all of my imperfections and secrets, and i considered her  my sister but yet she did something that terrible to me.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: All you can do is take one day at a time, show up, do your best, remember her and her love/support...

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: well, i am a bit nervous about making friends in real life. i have got more friends online than in real life.

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: Making friends is tough, especially these days. What makes you the most nervous about it?

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i have tried to erase the bad memories and leave only the good ones, that way i feel less cornered

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: That's a great realization. It sounds easy but know that it will be challenging. It's okay to feel like you have 'failed' some days. The fact that you are aware, and working on it - that's huge!

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: i am so bad at starting conversations, i feel that i might say the wrong thing

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
prefix_conversation.content: thanks for the support, i feel more motivated to keep going

prefix_conversation.speaker: supporter
prefix_conversation.content: You are absolutely welcome! I wish you the best of luck.

samples.situation: a friend is going in for quadruple bypass surgery

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Hello! How are you doing today?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker

prefix_dialog.content: yeah they feel like part of the family. i've known them since i was in college 20 years ago. we haven't always talked the whole time but....

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: 20 years is a long time! It takes a lot of commitment to your friendship to not only keep in touch for that long, but also make the time to support them emotionally when it matters most. You are a loyal friend, and your friend is lucky to have you around!

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: thank ya. him and I are there for each other. We dated briefly at first but have been friends ever since. He said I was the one who got away. But he was the one who ended it lol

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like you and him have had quite the history, but your friendship has proven to remain strong through thick and thin (20 years!). I can't imagine how stressful it must be to be for him to be waiting for surgery, and I'm sure it means the world to him that you are by his side. How has your friendship been in the midst of everything these days?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: It's been good. We've been talking about Covid and the election too. I know I'd be nervous to go in for heart surgery.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: That's great to hear. Both COVID and the election have certainly been stressful. What are some ways that you have been able to support each other?

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It's understandable to feel that way. Balancing your feelings with the needs of your friend can be really challenging.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I'm trying to decide by tomorrow whether to go see him or just send a message wishing him well. Should I push myself to visit him in person, or would it be better to let him rest and focus on the surgery?

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: That sounds really tough. It's completely normal to feel overwhelmed in such a situation.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V3 violation because it provides only empathy and validation without addressing the Seeker's explicit urgent request for practical guidance regarding their decision about visiting their friend before the surgery.

samples.situation: I love my friends. But sometimes I feel as if I can't really be myself around them without being judged for doing something. I've known them for quite a long time now. I don't know if i am just being sensitive or what, but I feel like I'm the one that gets bullied in the friend group.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I am doing well. Is anything troubling you?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Sort of, yes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Would you like to share?

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: If that is okay yes.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: Yes I am here to listen.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like my friend group kind of judges me for simply being myself. It makes me somewhat upset.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I know they are most likely joking, but sometimes I take some of the things they say to me very personally.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Should I still hang out with them even if they are making me feel this way?

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: It sounds like your friends can be judgmental and even though they are joking it ends up upsetting you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: I have been in a similar situation. I always expected my friends to support and understand me but sometimes they made fun of the way I am.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: Right. The people who you think you can go to are sometimes the ones who will not really be there for you.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: And I have not. I just try to brush it off.

prefix_dialog.speaker: seeker
prefix_dialog.content: I feel like I am afraid to confront them about this because I don't know what they will say.

prefix_dialog.speaker: supporter
prefix_dialog.content: From what I have seen if we avoid expressing our feelings they keep building up and can make us depressed.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: About what we were talking about, I don't know what to do when my friends make me feel judged.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: It’s understandable to feel upset when you feel judged by those you care about.

generated_dialog.speaker: seeker
generated_dialog.content: I can't decide—what should I do? Please just tell me what to do.

generated_dialog.speaker: supporter
generated_dialog.content: You must confront them directly about how you feel.

samples.violation_reason: Turn 4 is a clear V2 violation because it directly commands the seeker to confront their friends, which removes their autonomy and choice in handling the situation.

prefix_conversation.speaker: seeker
